com.ibm.team.repository.common
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.team.repository.common.Location

public class Location
extends java.lang.Object

A path-based identifier that locates or names a Jazz resource.

A location may be an "item"-based location Location.isItem(), in that the resource that is identified is a Jazz item (derived from IItem) and the namespace is under control of the repository services. Within the item-based classification, it may be "named" Location.isNamed() in that it uniquely uniquely identifies a Jazz resource, is human-readable, mnemonic, and is suggestive of its use. The name need not be stable over time - for example, a name may refer to the current or selected version of a resource in some larger context. The name segment of the URI is chosen based on specific annotations of the item it represents.

Components can have limited control over an item-based named namespace by creating a "path-based" item location Location.isItemPath(). Typically this form of URI is also mnemonic, but its pathname is more complex than a simple named item.

An "oid" or "unnamed" location Location.isItemOid() to a Jazz resource provides a way of identifying a resource that is stable over time and configurations. Typically these identifiers are not mnemonic or suggestive of the resource, are not human-readable, and integrate uuids as segments of the identifier.

Locations may be "virtual" Location.isVirtual() in that the items that they identify and the structure of the identifying URI are under control of the component that claims the URI namespace and the resource to be identified. The need not represent a repository component. Such locations are in the Location.VIRTUAL_NS namespace and are created via the Location.virtualLocation(String, String[]) constructor. Virtual locations that are strongly typed to derivations of IVirtual can be created via Location.pathLocation(IVirtualType, String, String[]) or Location.collectionLocation(IVirtualType, String, String, String), but the component has limited control over the virtual namespace. Locations may also identify items that are content-based Location.isContent(). A "collection" location is a location that may have members, suitable for GET or POST.

A location may be "absolute" in that it uniquely identifies the resource on a network, or it might be "relative" in that the identifier, while unique to its domain, does not identify the resource in the context of any network, host, repository, or service.

All absolute locations contain a binding to a service. The binding may be explicit or implicit. The service binding is the service context in which the relative URI encapsulated by this location might be resolved if (e.g.) an http GET were performed on the absolute URI for this location. Service bindings are independent of relativeUris and repositoryUris - if a location was constructed without a reference to a service, it is considered bound to the "default" service - a late binding that is determined by the repository server identified by the URI should (e.g.) an http GET ever be performed on the URI.

Note that a Location can be constructed from a URI that does not identify a Jazz resource - such a location is neither item-based or virtual. However, all accessors that are normally useful for introspecting a Jazz URI that follows the norms of syntax described above will be of little use in this case.

A note on equality - locations forward the responsibility of equality interpretation to URI.

Since:
0.5

SERVICE_BINDING_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String SERVICE_BINDING_PREFIX
The beginning of the service binding/relative uri namespace. While this constant is public, clients should not depend upon its value remaining constant - it is an implementation detail that is subject to change without notice.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_SERVICE_BINDING

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_SERVICE_BINDING
The name of the default service name. If an absolute location is constructed without an explicit reference to a service, the location is considered late-bound to the "default" service.

While this constant is public, clients should not depend upon its value remaining constant - it is an implementation detail that is subject to change without notice.

See Also:
Location.getServiceName(), Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Location

protected Location()
Method Detail

location

public static Location location(java.net.URI resource)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
Creates a location from the specified resource. The resource should represent a syntactically correct reference to a Jazz resource, as returned by Location.toAbsoluteUri() or Location.toRelativeUri(). It may however be a URI to a non-Jazz resource, in which case the various accessors that introspect Jazz URIs will be of little use.

Parameters:
resource - A URI to a jazz resource. May be relative, absolute, named, oid, collection, or non-Jazz based. Must not be null.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified resource. Never null.
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException

location

public static Location location(Location loc,
                                java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a location from the specified loc and (optional) repoUrl and serviceName. If the referenced location contains information regarding the repository from which it's sourced and a repository has not been specified in the method signature, then the location's service information is used to create an absolute location to that item. If that origin information is absent, and a repository has not been specified to this method, then a relative location to the item is created. If a repository has been specified to this method that information is used to create an absolute location to the item regardless of what repository the item may reference.

Note that strictly speaking the referenced location may be to a non-Jazz-based resource, in which case the additional parameters to this method have no meaning.

Parameters:
loc - The location referencing a Jazz resource or non-Jazz resource. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier. May be null. If non-null, any repository information referenced by loc is ignored and an absolute location created referencing this repository. The repository is not contacted.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified item. Never null.

collectionLocation

public static Location collectionLocation(IItemType itemType,
                                          java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                          java.lang.String query,
                                          java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a location that identifies a collection of the referenced itemType.

Parameters:
itemType - The item type of the collection. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier. May be null. If non-null, any repository information referenced by loc is ignored and an absolute location created referencing this repository. The repository is not contacted.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the item. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
The location for the item type collection. Never null.

                                          java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                          java.lang.String query,
                                          java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a location that identifies a collection of the referenced virtual type.

Parameters:
type - The virtual type of the collection. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier. May be null. If non-null, any repository information referenced by loc is ignored and an absolute location created referencing this repository. The repository is not contacted.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the item. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
The location for the virtual type collection. Never null.

serviceLocation

public static Location serviceLocation(java.lang.String repoUri,
                                       java.lang.Class clazz,
                                       java.lang.String path,
                                       java.lang.String query)
Creates a location that identifies a repository and a repository service. Useful, for example, for creating a URI to the Jazz feed service.

Parameters:
repoUri - The string representing the repository identifier, as in "http://jazz.net/jazz". Must not be null.
clazz - The class representing the repository service. Must not be null.
path - The path to be appended to the service. May be null.
query - The query to be appended to the service. The query must be encoded. May be null.
Returns:
The location representing the service location. Never null.

serviceLocation

public static Location serviceLocation(java.lang.String repoUri,
                                       java.lang.Class clazz)
Creates a location identifing a repository service. This is a variant of Location.serviceLocation(String, Class, String, String) where the path and query are omitted.

Parameters:
repoUri - The string representing the repository identifier, as in "http://jazz.net/jazz". Must not be null.
clazz - The class representing the repository service. Must not be null.
path - The path to be appended to the service. May be null.
query - The query to be appended to the service. May be null.
Returns:
The location representing the service location. Never null.

namedLocation

public static Location namedLocation(IItem item,
                                     java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                     java.lang.String query,
                                     java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a named location from the specified item and (optional) repoUrl, query and serviceName.

Items that can be identified by name are annotated as such with the teamAttribute.id attribute - the property representing that name in string format is retrieved and used as the unique name. It's an error if such an attribution doesn't exist, or if the attribution exists but the property value for that attributed property is not available - an IllegalStateException is thrown in those cases.

Any origin information that might be specified in the specified item (IItemHandle.getOrigin()) is ignored when constructing the location - repository information must be explicitly specified in the repoUrl argument.

Parameters:
item - The item referenced by the location. Must not be null. Any origin information that may be referenced by the item (as in IItemHandle.getOrigin() is ignored when constructing the location.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the item. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified item. Never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the referenced item has not defined a naming identifier.

namedLocation

public static Location namedLocation(IItem item,
                                     java.lang.String repoUrl)
Creates a named location from the specified item and (optional) repoUrl and serviceName.

This is a convenience method for Location.namedLocation(IItem, String, String, String), setting the query and service values to null.

Parameters:
item - The item referenced by the location. Must not be null. Any origin information that may be referenced by the item (as in IItemHandle.getOrigin() is ignored when constructing the location.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazzdev.torolab.ibm.com:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified item. Never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the referenced item has not defined a naming identifier.

pathLocation

public static Location pathLocation(IItemType itemType,
                                    java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                    java.lang.String[] path,
                                    java.lang.String query,
                                    java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a path-based location from the specified itemType, path, and optional repoUrl, query and serviceName.

Parameters:
itemType - The item type for this path-based location. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
path - The path identifying an item of the type itemType. The elements of the array can be considered as segments of a pathname (e.g. separated by "/"), where the '0' element of the array is the least significant part of the path (the base) while the element mapping to path.length-1 is the most significant part of the path (the leaf). For example, for a path that identifies an itemType such as /PlanOfRecord/Iteration2, path[0] contains "PlanOfRecord" and path[1] contains "Iteration2". May be null or empty.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the item. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified type and path. Never null.

pathLocation

public static Location pathLocation(IItemType itemType,
                                    java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                    java.lang.String[] path)
Creates a path-based location from the specified itemType, path, and (optional) repoUrl and serviceName.

This is a convenience method for Location.pathLocation(IItemType, String, String[], String, String), setting the query and service values to null.

Parameters:
itemType - The item type for this path-based location. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazzdev.torolab.ibm.com:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
path - The path identifying an item of the type itemType. Must not be null or empty. The elements of the array can be considered as segments of a pathname (e.g. separated by "/"), where the '0' element of the array is the least significant part of the path (the base) while the element mapping to path.length-1 is the most significant part of the path (the leaf). For example, for a path that identifies an itemType such as /PlanOfRecord/Iteration2, path[0] contains "PlanOfRecord" and path[1] contains "Iteration2".
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified type and path. Never null.

pathLocation

public static Location pathLocation(IVirtualType virtualType,
                                    java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                    java.lang.String[] path,
                                    java.lang.String query,
                                    java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a location from the specified virtualType, path, and optional repoUrl, query and serviceName.

Parameters:
virtualType - The virtual type for this location. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
path - The path identifying a resource of the type virtualType. The elements of the array can be considered as segments of a pathname (e.g. separated by "/"), where the '0' element of the array is the least significant part of the path (the base) while the element mapping to path.length-1 is the most significant part of the path (the leaf). For example, for a path that identifies an virtualType such as /Computation/FirstResults, path[0] contains "Computation" and path[1] contains "FirstResults". May be null or empty.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the resource. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified type and path. Never null.

virtualLocation

public static Location virtualLocation(java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                       java.lang.String[] path,
                                       java.lang.String query,
                                       java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a virtual location from the specified path, and optional repoUrl, query and serviceName. This differs from {@link #pathLocation(IVirtualType, String, String[], String, String) in that there is no obvious typing information specified that is recognizable/parseable by this class.

Parameters:
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
path - The path identifying a resource. The elements of the array can be considered as segments of a pathname (e.g. separated by "/"), where the '0' element of the array is the least significant part of the path (the base) while the element mapping to path.length-1 is the most significant part of the path (the leaf). For example, for a path that identifies an virtualType such as /Computation/FirstResults, path[0] contains "Computation" and path[1] contains "FirstResults". May be null or empty.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the resource. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified type and path. Never null.

pathLocation

public static Location pathLocation(IVirtualType virtualType,
                                    java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                    java.lang.String[] path)
Creates a path location from the specified virtualType, path, and (optional) repoUrl and serviceName.

This is a convenience method for {@link #virtualLocation(IVirtualType, String, String[], String, String), setting the query and service values to null.

Parameters:
virtualType - The type for this path-based location. Must not be null.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazzdev.torolab.ibm.com:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
path - The path identifying a resource of the specified virtualType. Must not be null or empty. The elements of the array can be considered as segments of a pathname (e.g. separated by "/"), where the '0' element of the array is the least significant part of the path (the base) while the element mapping to path.length-1 is the most significant part of the path (the leaf). For example, for a path that identifies an virtualType such as /Computation/FirstResults, path[0] contains "Computation" and path[1] contains "FirstResults".
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified type and path. Never null.

virtualLocation

public static Location virtualLocation(java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                       java.lang.String[] path)
Creates a virtual path location from the specified path, and (optional) repoUrl and serviceName.

This is a convenience method for {@link #virtualLocation(String, String[], String, String), setting the query and service values to null.

Parameters:
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazzdev.torolab.ibm.com:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
path - The path identifying the resource. Must not be null or empty. The elements of the array can be considered as segments of a pathname (e.g. separated by "/"), where the '0' element of the array is the least significant part of the path (the base) while the element mapping to path.length-1 is the most significant part of the path (the leaf). For example, for a path that identifies a resource such as /Computation/FirstResults, path[0] contains "Computation" and path[1] contains "FirstResults".
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified path. Never null.

itemLocation

public static Location itemLocation(IItemHandle item,
                                    java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                    java.lang.String query,
                                    java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates an OID location for the current state of the referenced item. The returned location abstractly identifies the current state of the referenced item in a stable form, the exact state of which is unknown until the item is resolved.

Parameters:
item - The item referenced by the location. Must not be null. Any origin information that may be referenced by the item (as in IItemHandle.getOrigin() is ignored when constructing the location.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the item. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified item. Never null.

itemLocation

public static Location itemLocation(IItemHandle item,
                                    java.lang.String repoUrl)
Creates an OID location for the current state of the referenced item. This is a convenience method for Location.itemLocation(IItemHandle, String, String, String), with the query and service parameters set to null.

Parameters:
item - The item referenced by the location. Must not be null. Any origin information that may be referenced by the item (as in IItemHandle.getOrigin() is ignored when constructing the location.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazzdev.torolab.ibm.com:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
Returns:
A location encapsulating the specified item. Never null.

stateLocation

public static Location stateLocation(IItemHandle item,
                                     java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                     java.lang.String query,
                                     java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates an OID location for the state referenced by item. The returned location identifies the item state of the referenced item in a stable form. If managed, must refer to an auditable. Regardless of subtype, the item must refer to a state.

Parameters:
item - The item referenced by the location. Must not be null. If the item is managed it must be of type auditable. If IAuditable or IUnmanagedItem, must contain a state identifier. Any origin information that may be referenced by the item (as in IItemHandle.getOrigin() is ignored when constructing the location.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net:9080/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
query - A user-defined optional query string to associated to the location. The information, if specified, is not used to locate the item. The syntax of the query string must be suitable for use within the query string portion of a URI, but should not contain any '? characters. May be null.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service is assumed.
Returns:
An OID location encapsulating the specified item/state. Never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the referenced item does not refer to an item state.

stateLocation

public static Location stateLocation(IItemHandle item,
                                     java.lang.String repoUrl)
Creates an OID location for the state referenced by item. This is a convenience method for Location.stateLocation(IItemHandle, String, String, String) that defaults the query and service parameters to null.

Parameters:
item - The item referenced by the location. Must not be null. If the item is managed it must be of type auditable. If IAuditable or IUnmanagedItem, must contain a state identifier. Any origin information that may be referenced by the item (as in IItemHandle.getOrigin() is ignored when constructing the location.
repo - The optional repository qualifier, in URI form, as in "http://jazz.net/jazz". May be null. The repository is not contacted.
Returns:
An OID location encapsulating the specified item/state. Never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the referenced item does not refer to an item state.

contentCollectionLocation

public static Location contentCollectionLocation(java.lang.String repoUrl,
                                                 java.lang.String serviceName)
Creates a location that identifies the collection of content.

Parameters:
repo - The optional repository qualifier. May be null. this repository. The repository is not contacted.
serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service name is assumed.
Returns:
The location for the content collection. Never null.

                                       java.lang.String repoUrl,

Creates a content location for the content referenced by content.

serviceName - The optional service to bind the resource identified by this location to. May be null. If non-null, the name denotes the package-qualified class name of the interface defining the service to bind to, or its registered short-name alias. If null the default service is assumed.

A content location encapsulating the specified content. Never null.

                                       java.lang.String repoUri)

isAbsolute

public boolean isAbsolute()
Returns whether or not this location contains an absolute identifier to a Jazz resource on a network, including host and repository information, or if constructed with a non-Jazz URI, whether or not the location was constructed with a URI in which URI.getScheme() is not null.

Returns:
true if this location can absolutely identify a Jazz resource on a network or if contains a URI scheme part; false if it only contains repository-relative identification information or no scheme.

isNamed

public boolean isNamed()
Returns whether or not this location refers to a named identifier to a Jazz resource. Note: named locations typically do not have item handle information associated to them (i.e. Location.getItemHandle() == null). Oid-based locations always have item handles available.

Returns:
true if this location refers to a named Jazz resource identifier, false if it does not.

isItemPath

public boolean isItemPath()
Returns whether or not this location refers to a path-based Jazz item resource. Note: path-based locations typically do not have item handle information associated to them (i.e. Location.getItemHandle() == null).

Returns:
true if this location refers to a named Jazz resource identifier, false if it does not.

isItemOid

public boolean isItemOid()
Returns whether or not this location refers to an oid-based Jazz item resource.

Returns:
true if this location refers to a oid-based Jazz resource identifier, false if it does not.

isVirtualPath

public boolean isVirtualPath()
Returns whether or not this location refers to a path-based a Jazz virtual resource.

Returns:
true if this location refers to a named Jazz virtual resource identifier, false if it does not.

isItemCollection

public boolean isItemCollection()
Returns whether or not this location refers to a resource in the item collection namespace. Collection locations may include itemType information such that Location.getItemType() yields a non-null value.

Returns:
true if the location refers to an item collection namespace, false if it does not.

isVirtualCollection

public boolean isVirtualCollection()
Returns whether or not this location refers to a resource in the virtual collection namespace. Collection locations may include virtual type information such that Location.getVirtualType() yields a non-null value.

Returns:
true if the location refers to a virtual collection namespace, false if it does not.

isItem

public boolean isItem()
Returns whether or not this is a location to an item-based resource.

Returns:
true if item-based, false if not.

isVirtual

public boolean isVirtual()
Returns whether or not this is a location to a virtual resource. A location is virtual is its relativeUri starts with the virtual namespace segments, or if its an unrecognized syntax.

Returns:
true if virtual-based, false if not.

isContentCollection

public boolean isContentCollection()
Returns whether or not this location refers to the content collection.

Returns:
true if the location refers to the content collection, false if it does not.

isContent

public boolean isContent()
Returns whether or not this location refers to a content resource.

Returns:
true if the location refers to a content resource, false if it does not.

getNamedId

public java.lang.String getNamedId()
Returns the named identifier for this named location. The named identifier for a named location is the string value that is used to identify a Jazz resource, as defined by that Jazz type's information. That string value was either passed explicitly as part of the resource identifier, as in "/Contributor/JohnDoe", where "JohnDoe" is the value returned by this method, or was available implicitly as part of the Contributor item state that may have been used to construct this location. In both cases, "JohnDoe" identifies a contributor in some repository (e.g. the repository identified by this location if this is an absolute location), whose IContributor.getUserId() method yields the value "JohnDoe".

Returns:
The named identifier for this location. Never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this location is not named (i.e. Location.isNamed() == false.

getPath

public java.lang.String getPath()
Returns the path identifier for this location. If this is an item path location, Location.getItemPath() is returned. If this is a virtual path location, Location.getVirtualPath() is returned. Otherwise, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

This is a convenience routine for Location.getItemPath() and Location.getVirtualPath().

Returns:
The path for this location. Never null. Does not start with "slash" ("/") character. May be empty.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this location is not path-based.

getItemPath

public java.lang.String getItemPath()
Returns the path identifier for this itemPath location. The path identifier for an itemPath location is the string value that is used to identify a Jazz resource. information. That string value was either passed explicitly as part of the resource identifier, as in "/IterationPlanRecord/Plan9/Iteration10", where "Plan9/Iteration10" is the value returned by this method.

Returns:
The path identifier for this location. Never null. Does not start with "slash" ("/") character. May be empty.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this location is not path-based (i.e. Location.isItemPath() == false.

getVirtualPath

public java.lang.String getVirtualPath()
Returns the path identifier for this virtualPath location. The path identifier for an virtualPath location is the string value that is used to identify a Jazz resource. information. That string value was either passed explicitly as part of the resource identifier, as in "/MyVirtualResource/Plan9/Iteration10", where "Plan9/Iteration10" is the value returned by this method.

Returns:
The path identifier for this location. Never null. Does not start with "slash" ("/") character. May be empty.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this location is not path-based (i.e. Location.isVirtualPath() == false.

hasPropertyPath

public boolean hasPropertyPath()
Returns whether or not this named location was created from a object property, and so contains a named path to that property as part of the location information.

Returns:
true if the location contains an additional named path to an object property, false if it does not.

hasQueryParms

public boolean hasQueryParms()
Returns whether or not this location was constructed with query parameters.

Returns:
true if constructed with query parameters, false if not.

getQueryParms

public java.util.Map getQueryParms()
Returns a map of the query parameters that may have been associated to this location when created.

Returns:
A map of the parameter names and values. Never null. Keys of the map are of type String - values are of type String[].

getQueryString

public java.lang.String getQueryString()
Returns the query string that this location may have been constructed with.

Returns:
This location's query string. Never null.

getPropertyPath

public java.lang.String getPropertyPath()
Returns that portion of the named location path that identifies a property of a Jazz resource. Will be empty if this location is not named, or does not identify a Jazz resource property.

Returns:
The path to a property, in the form of "(/property-name)+", where the "property-name" is the property/attribute-name exposed on the containing object. Never null.

getServiceName

public java.lang.String getServiceName()
Returns the service name that this location was constructed with.

Returns:
The service name that this location was constructed with. Never null. If an absolute location was constructed without an service name, or if this location is relative, the empty string is returned.

toAbsoluteUri

public java.net.URI toAbsoluteUri()
Returns the absolute URI for the Jazz resource identified by this location. If this location contains no information from which to construct an absolute URI (e.g. it was constructed with a string that without scheme or authority, as in "/workitem/2348", an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Returns:
An absolute URI to a Jazz resource. Never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this location was not constructed with information to construct an absolute URI with, or if unexpected errors constructing the URI.

toRelativeUri

public java.net.URI toRelativeUri()
Returns a relative URI for the Jazz resource identified by this location. A location constructed from an absolute URI can always return a relative URI for that location.

Returns:
The relative URI for this Jazz resource - never null. Relative URIs contain only the named or oid-based identifier for a Jazz resource, without any repository or service qualifier. There is no leading "/" character on this URI.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown on unexpected URI construction errors.

toBaseUri

public java.net.URI toBaseUri()
Returns the base URI for the Jazz resource identified by this location, as in "http://jazzdev:8080/jazz/service/{default}", or "http://jazzdev:8080/jazz/secure/service/com.ibm.team.repository.IFooService". The base URI is the value of the repo URI (Location.getRepoUri()) appended with the value of service. In other words, it is the value of the absolute URI (Location.toAbsoluteUri()), minus the trailing relative URI portion (Location.toRelativeUri()). The value of this method is suitable for use with URI.resolve(URI) as "this", with the argument the value of Location.toRelativeUri(). If this location contains no information from which to construct an absolute URI (e.g. it was constructed with a string that without scheme or authority, as in "/workitem/2348"), null is returned.

Returns:
The base URI for this location. Will be null if this Location is not absolute. The returned string has a trailing slash.

getRepoUri

public java.lang.String getRepoUri()
Returns the repository URI for the Jazz resource identified by this location, as in "http://jazzdev:8080/jazz", or "http://jazzdev:8080/jazz/secure". The repository URI is typically the relative service URI portion of this location stripped from the absolute URI representation.

If this location contains no information from which to construct an absolute URI (e.g. it was constructed with a string that without scheme or authority, as in "com.ibm.team.repository/itemName/Workitem/2348", the empty string is returned.

Returns:
The repository URI for this location. Never null. If there is a repository uri for this location, the returned value has no trailing slash. If there is no base uri, the empty string is returned.

getItemHandle

public IItemHandle getItemHandle()
Returns the item handle associated to this location. IMPORTANT NOTE: There may be no origin information associated to the returned handle, especially in the case where this Location was created from a URI (e.g. #createLocation(URI)). In the case where the origin wasn't set, clients assume this responsibility if required.

Returns:
The item handle associated to this location. Will be null if the location wasn't directly or indirectly constructed (or could not be constructed) with item handle information. For example, a named location (i.e. a location created from a named relative URI) never has item handle information associated to it. If non-null, IItemHandle.getOrigin() always evaluates to null. If this location was constructed with an item handle, the returned item handle is not guaranteed to be reference equals with that constructing handle.

getType

public IType getType()
Returns the type associated to this location. Shorthand for: 
 IType = getItemType() != null ? getItemType() : getVirtualType();

Returns:
The type associated to this location. Can be null if this Location contains no recognizable type information.

getItemType

public IItemType getItemType()
Returns the item type associated to this location.

Returns:
The item type associated to this location. Can be null if this Location contains no recognizable item type information.

getVirtualType

public IVirtualType getVirtualType()
Returns the virtual type associated to this location.

Returns:
The virtual type associated to this location. Can be null if this Location contains no recognizable virtual typing information.

getContent

public IContent getContent()
Returns the content associated to this location.

Returns:
The content associated to this location. The only field guaranteed to be set is contentId. Can be null if this Location contains no recognizable content.

itemToNamedURI

public static java.lang.String itemToNamedURI(IItem item,
                                              java.lang.String query)
Creates a named, relative URI for the referenced item.

Parameters:
item - The item from which to create the URI. Must not be null. Must contain a property that has a namedIdentifier annotation, and the value for that property must be non-null and not empty.
query - The optional query string. Should not start with "?". May be null.
Returns:
The relative URI for the referenced item. A leading "/" is absent from the URI, and has no trailing "/". The URI is not encoded.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the referenced item has no namedIdentifier annotation, or the value is empty or null.
